result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M Salm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin M Salm is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin M Salm was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance to be refunded to the poster.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M Salm

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:46 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - met with DA and has reached an agreement.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to count 2, count 1 will be dismissed.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation..

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2.  Court orders count 1 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-Court costs.    Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.  Balance to be refunded to the poster.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:54 a.m.
Status hearing on April 12, 2016 at 09:15 am.

9:53 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court sets for Status hearing on April 12, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.  Defendant to make appointment with the DA's office before leaving today.

Court adjourned at 9:54 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing on March 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:55 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation - requests cash bond continue.  Court notes a $700 cash bond has been posted and orders cash bond to continue.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 28, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:57 a.m.
